channel.title: Oh computer gurus I need some help...
channel.description: For a class assignment, I need to compile a list of expenses on what I would need to spend, one thing I'm not so sure of is how to build a proper machine that can render things from programs such as 3DSMax properly. I know how to build a gaming computer (as I have one at home that's custom built that I built myself), but this is new territory for me. Anyone got ideas on what kind of specs I should look for in terms of hardware and the like?

item.title: Oh computer gurus I need some help...
item.dc:creator: CPU
item.description:
Your immediate objective is to complete the assignment successfully,it’s not about utilizing your gained knowledge later on.

Focus on the assignment. Worry about the knowledge later when it’s necessary.

Read full topic
item.source: Oh computer gurus I need some help...

item.title: Oh computer gurus I need some help...
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
The thing is, is that I plan on using the gained knowledge later on when I consolidate everything together to run my own studio, so I do need to know specifics.

@Mink Thanks, I’ll look at the info on my spare time a little later.

Edit: More to the point really would be what should I look for in GPUs, etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Oh computer gurus I need some help...

item.title: Oh computer gurus I need some help...
item.dc:creator: CPU
item.description:
Chickenprotector:

For a class assignment, I need to compile a list of expenses on what I would need to spend, one thing I’m not so sure of is how to build a proper machine that can render things from programs such as 3DSMax properly. I know how to build a gaming computer (as I have one at home that’s custom built that I built myself), but this is new territory for me. Anyone got ideas on what kind of specs I should look for in terms of hardware and the like?

And, keep in mind, your instructor doesn’t know about all the specifics of all the things that all of the class will expound on. He/She is simply looking for proof you provide of the expense that you incur and the reasoning about it. It’s not about the specifics, it’s about how well you explain and verify why you are doing what you are doing.

Read full topic
item.source: Oh computer gurus I need some help...

item.title: Oh computer gurus I need some help...
item.dc:creator: DaftMink
item.description:
Why don’t you just look up the requirements for the programs you need to run.
https://knowledge.autodesk.com/support/3ds-max/troubleshooting/caas/sfdcarticles/sfdcarticles/System-requirements-for-Autodesk-3ds-Max-2015.html

AutoDesk 3ds Max 2015 wants a 64bit CPU, 8 GB’s ram, and it uses 5 GB’s of HDD space.
There’s also stuff about acceptable graphics cards, thinking most of Nvidia’s quadro series will work.

Read full topic
item.source: Oh computer gurus I need some help...

item.title: Oh computer gurus I need some help...
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
So a render machine?

As far as I know, think a gaming computer, but with more RAM and maybe graphics cards.
Also cooling.
You’d want at least a 6-8 core 3gHz processor, maybe an SSD if it would also be used for video editing, and as good a graphics card as you can find.

Disclaimer: I do not own a dedicated render machine, nor have I built one. All my information is based off things I’ve heard in the past.

Read full topic
item.source: Oh computer gurus I need some help...
